page.title: 10LYNEHAM CHURCHES
page.content: LYNEHAM HAS THREE CHURCHES THE METHODIST/FREE CHURCH BUILT IN 1934. THE CATHOLIC CHURCH BUILT BY THE R.A.F. IN 1968 AND THE OLDEST OF THE THREE,ST. MICHAEL'S AND ALL SAINTS C OF E.WHICH DATES BACK TO 1139. THE NEARBY VILLAGE OF BRADENSTOKE HAS ITS OWN CHURCH BUT SHARES ITS VICAR WITH LYNEHAM.THIS IS ALWAYS AN R.A.F. PADRE AS ARE THE OTHER TWO PRIESTS OF THE VILLAGE.THIS WORKS WELL, LINKING VILLAGE AND R.A.F. COMMUNITIES. ST MICHAEL'S IS VERY INTERESTING BEING SO OLD THE NORTH AISLE IS 14TH CENTURY, AND THE BELFRY SCREEN IS JACOBEAN. THERE IS A WONDERFUL YEW TREE OUTSIDE THE MAIN DOOR,PERHHAPS AS OLD AS AS THE CHURCH.A PAINTING OF 1806 SHOWS IT AS A LARGE ESTABLISHED TREE.
